info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 21 at 6:38PM EDT until July 21 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM EDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTH CENTRAL WORCESTER AND NORTHWESTERN MIDDLESEX COUNTIES... At 638 PM EDT, trained weather spotters in Hubbardston reported flooding on Route 68 in Hubbardston. In addition, Massachusetts Department of Transportation reported that both sides of Route 2 near mile marker 98 were closed from flooding in Leominster. Between 2.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.25 to 0.5 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is already occurring, and while rain has lightened up, additional thunderstorms over northwestern Massachusetts may move into the warned area over the next hour. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters and department of highways. IMPACT...Flash flooding of urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Sharp rises on creeks and streams in the warned area to over bankfull. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Leominster, Fitchburg, Gardner, Pepperell, Groton, Lunenburg, Townsend, Lancaster, Templeton, Sterling, Westminster, Shirley, Ashburnham, Hubbardston, Princeton, Ashby and Phillipston. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.25-0.5 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
